title: Calories in a Scone
meta_description: Discover calories in a scone, including full nutrition breakdown like carbs, protein, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard plain scone, baked, about 60 g, made with flour, butter, milk, and sugar; no fillings or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, size, ingredients, and baking method. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: A typical plain scone contains about 200 kcal and 4 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add clotted cream and jam (1 tbsp each)

faqs.q: How many calories in a plain scone?
faqs.a: About 200 kcal for a standard 60 g plain scone.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a scone?
faqs.a: Roughly 30 g carbs, including 1 g fiber and 3 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is a scone high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 7 g total fat, with 4 g saturated from butter.

faqs.q: How does scone size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger scones (80 g) may have 250+ kcal; smaller ones under 150 kcal.
Traditional ones aren't; gluten-free versions use alternative flours but calories are similar.
